intro: Ossaea bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahamian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ossaea bahiensis is often found in dune ecosystems and plays a role in stabilizing coastal habitats.
